rename.from: Panic after changing the repository settings (update time, keep revisions)
rename.to: Panic after changing the repository settings (keep revisions)

body:
Update: These lines of the config are at fault: Removing them "fixed" the panic.

```
<versioning type="staggered">
            <param key="maxAge" val="5184000"></param>
            <param key="cleanInterval" val="3600"></param>
            <param key="versionsPath" val=""></param>
        </versioning>
```

rename.from: Panic after changing the repository settings (keep revisions)
rename.to: Panic after changing the repository settings (staggered versioning)

body:
if i understand the log correctly the error is generated by

```
if f.Mode().IsRegular()
```

at line 62 of the staggered versioner. Probably we need a check for the error that the function gets from filepath.Walk and send a warning or info insted of crashing.

If your .stversions folder does not exist i already reproduced that. The function to check for versions with old naming does not create it and crashes when it does not exist.
As a temporary fix create it manually in your repo. I can send a pull request to fix it later.

issue.title: panic just after initial scan of 16GB 100K+ item repository

labels.name: frozen-due-to-age
labels.description: Issues closed and untouched for a long time, together with being locked for discussion

issue.body:
Just after syncthing v0.9.14 finished its initial index of a 16GB 100K+ file repository on Ubuntu 14.04 x64, it yielded the following panic:

```
panic: runtime error: invalid memory address or nil pointer dereference
[signal 0xb code=0x1 addr=0x30 pc=0x6ccac5]
```

I have to kill -9 syncthing to get rid of the process. When I start it again, it gives exactly the same panic.

I'm not able to attach the log file to this issue, so I'm going to have to paste its contents.

```
Panic at Thu, 11 Sep 2014 19:48:48 SAST

[ERS4O] 19:48:48 INFO: Starting global discovery announcements
[ERS4O] 19:48:48 OK: Ready to synchronize default (read-write)
[ERS4O] 19:48:48 OK: Ready to synchronize sync (read-write)
...
```

body: Thanks for the quick fix, works now!
